intro: Chengiopanax, commonly known as the Chinese arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small white or greenish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Chengiopanax is typically found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions.
